vision: A comprehensive web-based management interface for Claude agents, skills, slash commands, and MCP servers

target_audience.primary: Developers building AI applications with Claude who need to manage, configure, and execute Claude agents through a visual interface rather than command-line tools
secondary: AI/ML Engineers configuring complex agent workflows
DevOps engineers managing MCP server configurations
Technical Product Managers monitoring agent usage and performance
Teams building agentic AI products who need shared agent management

phases.name: Foundation - MVP Completion
phases.description: Complete essential MVP features, fix known gaps, and establish a stable foundation. Focus on making core features production-ready.

milestones.title: Conversation Persistence Complete
milestones.description: Users can retrieve and delete conversation history, enabling session continuity

milestones.title: Database Migration Complete
milestones.description: PostgreSQL is the primary database with stable migrations and no data loss

milestones.title: Agent Input Fields Working
milestones.description: Agents can define and collect custom input fields before execution

milestones.title: MCP Integration Enhanced
milestones.description: MCP server tools are fully integrated with agent execution

phases.name: Enhancement - User Experience
phases.description: Improve user experience with better debugging, monitoring, and workflow efficiency. Address competitor pain points around complexity and visibility.

milestones.title: Execution Tracing Live
milestones.description: Real-time visibility into agent execution with action logging and trace visualization

milestones.title: Enhanced Agent Management
milestones.description: Improved agent editing, versioning, and dependency management

milestones.title: Dashboard Analytics Available
milestones.description: Centralized dashboard with usage analytics and performance metrics

phases.name: Scale - Team Features
phases.description: Enable team collaboration, add enterprise features, and optimize for production scale. Address market gaps around self-hosting and team workflows.

milestones.title: Multi-User Support Ready
milestones.description: Role-based access control and team workspaces are functional

milestones.title: Production Optimization Complete
milestones.description: Performance optimized with caching, batch operations, and efficient resource usage

phases.name: Future - Advanced Capabilities
phases.description: Long-term vision features including advanced agent orchestration, marketplace integration, and platform expansion.

milestones.title: Agent Marketplace Live
milestones.description: Community can share and discover agents, skills, and workflows

milestones.title: Visual Workflow Execution
milestones.description: Flow builder can orchestrate multi-agent workflows with visual execution feedback

features.title: Conversation History Retrieval
features.description: Implement the ability to retrieve past conversations from the database, allowing users to resume previous agent sessions and review execution history.
features.rationale: Critical for session continuity. Without this, users lose context when refreshing or returning to the UI. Addresses the TODO in execution.routes.ts and mirrors functionality users expect from chat interfaces.
acceptance_criteria: Users can view a list of past conversations
Selecting a conversation loads the full message history
Conversation metadata (agent, timestamp, status) is displayed
Pagination works for conversations with many messages
user_stories: As a developer, I want to view my past agent conversations so that I can review what was discussed and pick up where I left off

features.title: Conversation Deletion
features.description: Enable users to delete conversations from the database to manage storage and remove sensitive or irrelevant sessions.
features.rationale: Essential for data management and privacy. Users need control over their data. Addresses TODO in execution.routes.ts.
acceptance_criteria: Bulk delete option for multiple conversations
user_stories: As a developer, I want to delete old conversations so that I can manage storage and remove sensitive test data

features.title: Complete PostgreSQL Migration
features.description: Finish the migration from SQLite to PostgreSQL as the primary database, ensuring data integrity, proper migrations, and production-ready configuration.
features.rationale: PostgreSQL provides better performance, reliability, and scalability for production workloads. Addresses technical debt from mixed database approach. Critical for avoiding the data loss bugs seen in Langflow.
acceptance_criteria: Migration scripts work without data loss
SQLite code paths removed or clearly deprecated
user_stories: As a DevOps engineer, I want a stable PostgreSQL setup so that I can deploy the application with confidence in production

features.title: Agent Input Fields Implementation
features.description: Implement the inputFields feature in the Strapi schema and UI, allowing agents to define custom input parameters that users fill in before execution.
features.rationale: Many agents need context-specific inputs (project path, API key, custom instructions). This is marked as TODO in AgentExecutionModal.tsx and is essential for flexible agent usage.
acceptance_criteria: Agents can define input fields with types (text, select, file, boolean)
Input fields are displayed in execution modal
Validation rules can be set per field
Field values are passed to agent execution context
user_stories: As a developer, I want to define input fields for my agents so that users provide the necessary context before execution

features.title: MCP Server Tools Integration
features.description: Complete the integration between MCP servers and agent execution, ensuring agents can use tools from configured MCP servers during execution.
features.rationale: MCP server tools are a key differentiator but the TODO in execution.routes.ts indicates this isn't fully wired up. Visual MCP management is unique to this product and addresses a major market gap.
acceptance_criteria: Agents can list available MCP tools
Selected MCP tools are available during execution
Tool responses are visible in execution output
user_stories: As a developer, I want my agents to use MCP server tools so that they can access external capabilities like database queries or API calls

features.title: Sensitive Tools Permission Prompt
features.description: Implement a user permission prompt for sensitive tool operations, allowing users to approve or deny tool calls that could have significant effects.
features.rationale: Currently marked as TODO in chat-service.ts. Critical for security and user trust. Addresses competitor concerns about agents performing actions without confirmation.
acceptance_criteria: Tools can be marked as sensitive in configuration
Permission modal appears before sensitive tool execution
User can approve, deny, or approve-all for session
Denied tools result in graceful agent handling
user_stories: As a developer, I want to be prompted before agents execute sensitive operations so that I maintain control over potentially dangerous actions

features.title: Skills Import Ordering
features.description: Fix the import order to ensure skills are imported before agents that reference them, preventing broken references during bulk import.
features.rationale: Directly addresses the TODO in manager.routes.ts. Essential for reliable import/export functionality which is a key workflow for configuration backup and sharing.
acceptance_criteria: Import detects skill dependencies in agents
Skills are imported first in correct order
Clear error messages if skill references are broken
user_stories: As a developer, I want imports to handle dependencies correctly so that I can reliably transfer configurations between environments

features.title: Message ID Tracking Improvement
features.description: Implement proper message ID tracking from the backend to ensure reliable message threading and referencing in the UI.
features.rationale: Addresses TODO in MessageBubble.tsx. Essential for features like message editing, referencing, and proper conversation threading.
acceptance_criteria: Each message has a unique backend-generated ID
IDs are consistent across page refreshes
Messages can be referenced by ID in subsequent requests
ID format supports future threading features
user_stories: As a developer, I want reliable message IDs so that I can reference specific messages in follow-up interactions

features.title: Execution Trace Visualization
features.description: Provide a visual timeline of agent execution showing each action, tool call, and decision point with timing information.
features.rationale: Addresses the top competitor pain point of debugging and visibility issues (pain-1-4, pain-1-5, pain-2-5). Real-time execution visibility is a key market gap. This differentiates from opaque frameworks like LangChain.
acceptance_criteria: Timeline shows each tool call with timestamp
Failed actions highlighted with error details
Export trace as JSON for debugging
user_stories: As a developer, I want to see exactly what my agent did during execution so that I can debug issues and understand its reasoning

features.title: Execution Action Logging
features.description: Log all agent actions to the database with structured metadata, enabling historical analysis and audit trails.
features.rationale: Complements trace visualization. Addresses n8n pain point about agents performing actions without logging (pain-4-3). Essential for debugging and compliance.
acceptance_criteria: All tool calls logged with parameters and results
Logs can be exported for external analysis
user_stories: As a developer, I want execution logs persisted so that I can analyze agent behavior over time and audit what actions were taken

features.title: Agent Versioning
features.description: Track changes to agent configurations over time, allowing users to view history, compare versions, and roll back to previous configurations.
features.rationale: Addresses LangChain pain about breaking changes (pain-1-2). Version control for configurations helps teams maintain stability and understand what changed when issues arise.
acceptance_criteria: Each save creates a new version
user_stories: As a developer, I want to track changes to my agents so that I can understand what changed and revert if needed

features.title: Skill Usage Analytics
features.description: Enhance the existing skills-usage endpoint with detailed analytics showing usage frequency, performance metrics, and cross-agent dependencies.
features.rationale: Builds on existing feature to address the market gap around skill tracking (gap-4). Helps users understand which skills are most valuable and identify unused ones.
user_stories: As a developer, I want to see how my skills are being used so that I can prioritize improvements and identify unused skills

features.title: Centralized Dashboard
features.description: Create a unified dashboard view showing all agents, skills, MCP servers, and recent executions at a glance with key metrics and quick actions.
features.rationale: Addresses user goal of having a centralized dashboard for all AI agent assets. Provides the overview that CLI-only tools lack (pain-7-3).
acceptance_criteria: Single page shows counts of all entities
Quick action buttons for common tasks
user_stories: As a developer, I want a dashboard that gives me an overview of my entire agent ecosystem so that I can quickly understand the current state

features.title: Model Version Pinning
features.description: Allow agents to pin to specific Claude model versions, preventing unexpected behavior changes when models are updated.
features.rationale: Addresses the Claude CLI pain point about model regressions after updates (pain-7-5). Important for production stability.
acceptance_criteria: Agent configuration includes model version field
List of available model versions from Anthropic API
Easy upgrade path to newer versions
user_stories: As a developer, I want to pin my agent to a specific model version so that its behavior remains consistent over time

features.title: Improved Error Handling and Recovery
features.description: Implement comprehensive error handling with clear error messages, recovery suggestions, and automatic retry logic for transient failures.
features.rationale: Addresses multiple competitor pain points about opaque failures (pain-2-5, pain-4-1). Clear error handling is essential for production reliability.
user_stories: As a developer, I want clear error messages and recovery suggestions so that I can quickly resolve issues without deep debugging

features.title: Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
features.description: Implement user roles (admin, developer, viewer) with granular permissions for agents, skills, and MCP servers.
features.rationale: Critical enterprise feature that Flowise lacks (pain-2-1). Essential for team adoption and security in production environments.
acceptance_criteria: UI elements hidden based on permissions
user_stories: As a team lead, I want to control what team members can access and modify so that I can maintain security and organization

features.title: Team Workspaces
features.description: Enable teams to organize agents, skills, and configurations into shared workspaces with collaboration features.
features.rationale: Addresses secondary persona of teams building agentic AI products. Differentiates from individual-focused tools.
acceptance_criteria: Shared resources visible to all members
user_stories: As a team member, I want to share agents and skills with my team so that we can collaborate on AI development

features.title: Execution Queue and Rate Limiting
features.description: Implement a queue system for agent executions with rate limiting to prevent API overload and manage costs.
features.rationale: Addresses n8n and CrewAI issues with performance and rate limiting (pain-4-2, pain-6-5). Essential for production deployments.
acceptance_criteria: Executions are queued when limit reached
user_stories: As a developer, I want execution rate limiting so that I don't accidentally exceed API limits or incur unexpected costs

features.title: Caching Layer
features.description: Implement intelligent caching for repeated tool calls and responses to improve performance and reduce API costs.
features.rationale: Addresses Langflow memory leak issues with caching (pain-3-3) by implementing proper caching. Improves performance for common operations.
acceptance_criteria: Cache responses from deterministic tool calls
user_stories: As a developer, I want repeated operations to be cached so that my agents execute faster and cost less

features.title: Batch Operations API
features.description: Add API endpoints for batch operations on agents, skills, and MCP servers to enable efficient bulk management.
features.rationale: Extends existing bulk-delete to full batch operations. Important for teams managing many agents.
user_stories: As a developer, I want to perform batch operations so that I can efficiently manage large numbers of agents and skills

features.title: Webhook Triggers
features.description: Allow agents to be triggered via webhooks, enabling integration with external systems and automation pipelines.
features.rationale: Addresses integration needs for DevOps engineers. Enables event-driven agent execution.
acceptance_criteria: Generate unique webhook URLs per agent
user_stories: As a DevOps engineer, I want to trigger agents via webhooks so that I can integrate them with CI/CD pipelines and other systems

features.title: Agent Marketplace - Discovery
features.description: Create a marketplace where users can discover and import community-shared agents, skills, and workflows.
features.rationale: Leverages Claude's unique capabilities (gap-5) and creates network effects. Differentiation through community.
user_stories: As a developer, I want to discover pre-built agents so that I can quickly get started without building from scratch

features.title: Agent Marketplace - Publishing
features.description: Enable users to publish their agents and skills to the marketplace with versioning and update management.
features.rationale: Completes the marketplace ecosystem. Encourages community contribution and knowledge sharing.
user_stories: As a developer, I want to share my agents with the community so that others can benefit from my work

features.title: Flow Builder Execution
features.description: Enhance the existing flow builder to execute visual workflows, orchestrating multiple agents in sequence or parallel.
features.rationale: Leverages the @xyflow/react investment. Addresses the CrewAI pain point about multi-agent reliability (pain-6-1, pain-6-2) by providing clear visual orchestration.
acceptance_criteria: Visual flow execution with live status
user_stories: As a developer, I want to execute my visual workflows so that I can orchestrate complex multi-agent tasks

features.title: Agent Templates Library
features.description: Provide built-in templates for common agent use cases (code review, documentation, data analysis) to accelerate onboarding.
features.rationale: Reduces the steep learning curve that plagues competitors (pain-5-1). Helps new users get value quickly.
user_stories: As a new user, I want pre-built templates so that I can quickly create useful agents without starting from scratch

features.title: Uygulamanın genel yapısını düzenleyeceğiz; yani uygulamanın amacı vs. bunlar ne olacaksa onu belirleyeceğiz
features.description:
Uygulamada şunu yapması gerekiyor. Aslında, agent skill MCP gibi yapıları şu anda destekliyor. Bir agent ekleyip bu agenta skill verebiliyoruz. Buradaki amacımız, aslında agent var, skill'ler var. Bunları bir workflow içerisinde, yani bir flow içerisinde düzenleyebilmek ve sabit süreçleri buraya tanımlayabilmek.

Nasıl? Bir örnekten gidelim. Mesela, "website scraper" diye bir şeyimiz var. Biz ona input olarak bir web sitesi veriyoruz. O bize çıktı olarak, işte marktan formatında, web sitenin tamamına bakan bir yapı; yani web sitenin alt sayfalarına kadar böyle detaylı bir analiz yapan bir yapı var. Bu da bir ne diyelim, buna bir job diyebiliriz, flow diyebiliriz veya bunun adına.

Bunun iç designinin yapılması, yani "web scraper" diye bir flow'umuz olacak. Bu flow'un altında da bir agent bağlı olacak. Örnekteki olarak veriyorum, input ile başlayacak. Input, hangi web sitesinin adı verildi, gerekiyorsa description verilir; yani tanımların yapılabileceği bir yer olacak. 

Sonrasında da agenta gelecek. Agentı da nasıl çalıştırılacaksa, zaten agentla tanımlı skiller de tanımlar yapılabilir. Agent, zaten geliştirirken skillerin nasıl kullanılacağını, o input-output'u düzenleyebilecek ki agent oluştururken de AI buna göre zaten oluşturacak. 

Burası bir yapıda olacak. Sonrasında da bunu çalıştırıp output verecek. Output da dosya olarak kaydedebilir, zipli ip verebilir; süreçten sürece değişir. Database'de logon tutarsan, onları paketleyip verir gibi bir şey olacak aslında burada.
features.rationale:
Şimdi diğer bütün tool'lar, mesela senin de şu an üzerinde çalıştığın Auto Cloud Tool'ı, hep böyle bir proje üzerinde geniş perspektiften bakarak işi yapıyor. 

Aslında bu geliştirdiğimiz tool'ı, bunu şeye indiriyor, yani kullanıcının süreci seviyesine. Kullanıcı bir RP süreci buraya konumlayabilir. Bir Excel koyabilir bunun içerisine, agent'a tanımlayıp süreci baştan aşağıya yönetebilir. Bir web browser'a giriş yapabilir. Veya e-posta geldiği zaman gelip tetikleyebilir gibi bir yapılı olacak. 

Yani bu Flow'un agent çalıştırması, buradan outputları, yani böyle genel kullanımı kolay, agent tanımı olan, agent'a skill'lerin bağlandığı ve bunların bir workflow üzerinden yönetilebildiği, schedule'lı, trigger'lı vs. böyle bir uygulama olmasını istiyoruz. 

Yani burada geniş kapsamda birazcık düşünüp, ilk aşamada geliştirme yaparken sadece benim kullanacağım şekilde olması gerekiyor. Yani production'daki security vs. genişleme, bunların hiçbirini göze alma. 

Direkt proje gibi yapma yani bu süreci. Sadece ben kullanacağım şekilde düşün. Çok art core production'a çıkmakla uğraşma.
